FAQ.question: What is a Maharashtra Property Audit Report (Non-Agriculture)?
FAQ.answer: It is a detailed verification report that checks ownership, registration history, encumbrances, and legal status of non-agricultural properties such as flats, plots, and commercial units in Maharashtra.

FAQ.question: Why is the Property Audit Report important?
FAQ.answer: It helps buyers, owners, and banks ensure that the property has clear title, no disputes, and no missing or risky documents before a purchase or loan.

FAQ.question: What details are required to start the audit?
FAQ.answer: You need the district, SRO/Registrar Office, property address, CTS/Survey number, document number, registration year, and owner details.

FAQ.question: How long does the audit process take?
FAQ.answer: The audit usually takes 24â€“48 hours, depending on document availability and verification requirements.

FAQ.question: What will I receive in the final audit report?
FAQ.answer: You will receive a detailed report covering ownership validation, document checks, encumbrance status, risk findings (if any), and recommendations for resolving issues.
